results.title: The Changing cotton land: USA - the southeast
results.creator_credit: United World Films, Louis De Rochemont and Bill Colleran
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
In this section of southeast America, cotton and tobacco have depleted the soil over a long period of time and the damage done is now being slowly repaired. new crops and new industries are being introduced. The film shows something of the work of the county agent at Laurel, Mississippi, who visits every farm and aids the farmer in improving the crops and livestock. Students at the State Agricultural College experiment with seeds, soil analysis, etc. Crops include pecan trees, tung trees, legume crops, sweet potatoes etc. A program of conservation of the forests is in operation, and the saw mills turn out wood fibre for composition board. Textile factories from the north provide additional employment.

results.title: The Changeover
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Eileen Molony
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery and Experience”.
As there is growing emphasis in education on what a child does rather than what the teacher says, a gradual change in teaching methods and class management has taken place. Discusses new concepts in teaching, teacher training, classroom organisation and the attitude of the teacher to the children. Suitable for teacher training.

results.title: The Changeling
results.creator_credit: Joel B Michaels, Garth Drabinsky and Peter Medak
results.brief_description: A grieving composer, George C Scott, moves to Seattle after the tragic death of his wife and daughter in a car accident. He discovers the house he has moved into harbours a secret and is inhabited by the spirit of a child who lived there 70 years ago. He is determined to find the explanation behind the terrifying paranormal activities. Based on a true story this film also stars Trish Van Devere, John Colicos and Jean Marsh

results.title: The Change at Groote
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Richard Mason and Stefan Sargent
results.brief_description: Designed to show how the aboriginal people of Groote Eylandt in the Gulf of Carpentaria are adjusting to the new life brought about by the discovery on their lands of vast manganese deposits which are now being mined by Broken Hill Proprietary. Made as a fragmented collage of images and sounds, it is intended to produce a direct emotional response, and suggest the confused values of the aboriginals undergoing a social and cultural revolution.

results.title: The Champions. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Katadotis, Donald Brittain and Janet Leissner
results.brief_description: Rene Levesque and Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Canada’s chief political protagonists, are the focus of this two part documentary. Part one covers their early years up to 1967. Using rare photos, newsreel footage and interviews with close political colleagues, the film provides the background to the struggle between the two men and their ideologies. In doing so, it helps to illuminate a great crisis in Canadian history. Awards: Toronto

results.title: The Champion = Battling Charlie [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Essanay Film Manufacturing Company, Griffiths Short Films and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: The Champion, Chaplin’s third film for Essanay, is easily one of the funniest and is his most advanced film to date in plotting and characterisation. We meet Charlie and his bulldog sharing a hot dog. As they pass a gymnasium advertising for sparring partners, Charlie finds a lucky horseshoe and decides to give sparring a go, putting the horseshoe into his left boxing glove. Obviously Charlie has a special advantage and eventually wins his way through to the big championship fight against Champ (Bud Jamison). Along the way the beautiful daughter of the Gym owner,(Edna Purviance) is attracted to Charlie and likewise Charlie is interested in her. The hilarious slapstick prizefight is pretty even at first but when Charlie appears to be getting the worst of it, his bulldog springs to the rescue.

results.title: The Chameleon
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and Films of Africa
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the chameleon, film in its natural habitat in Rhodesia. General and close-up shots illustrate the animal’s appearance and movements, details of feet and eye movements, colour changes of the skin in response to light and temperament. Normal and slow-motion photography shows the action of the tongue in catching insect food. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Challenge of water
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Joe Scully
results.brief_description: The challenge of Australia’s water resources - a problem, as good rainfall suited to agriculture occurs only in coastal regions. Describes government schemes for irrigation, hydro-electricity, reservoirs and other sources of water, including artesian bores. Indicates the widespread research which has made possible a better understanding of our climate today; includes work on evaporation control, artificial rain-making and sea-water utilisation.
